section.title: Configuring the vSphere Environment
section.para: Before deploying &ostack; with NSX-v, the VMware vSphere environment must be properly configured, including setting up vSphere distributed switches and port groups. For detailed instructions, see .
Installing and configuring the VMware NSX Manager and creating the NSX network within the vSphere environment is covered below.
Before proceeding with the installation, ensure that the following are configured in the vSphere environment.

listitem.para: The vSphere datacenter is configured with at least two clusters, one control-plane cluster and one compute cluster.
Verify that all software, hardware, and networking requirements have been met.
Ensure the vSphere distributed virtual switches (DVS) are configured for each cluster.

note.para: The MTU setting for each DVS should be set to 1600. NSX should automatically apply this setting to each DVS during the setup process. Alternatively, the setting can be manually applied to each DVS before setup if desired.

section.para: Make sure there is a copy of the &cloudos; .iso in the ardana home directory, var/lib/ardana, and that it is called sles12sp3.iso.

section.title: Deploying &productname;
section.para: With vSphere environment setup completed, the &ostack; can be deployed. The following sections will cover creating virtual machines within the vSphere environment, configuring the cloud model and integrating NSX-v &o_netw; core plugin into the &ostack;:
